recipe.name: Super Quick Chicken Dinner: Crumbed Chicken with Mashed Potatoes
recipe.description: With few clever shortcuts and a bit of multi tasking, you'll get this complete dinner on the table in 15 minutes. The crunchy crumbed chicken is sensational. The secret is mayonnaise which is used to make the panko breadcrumbs stick to the chicken, plus it provides the seasoning.
recipeIngredient: 400 g / 13oz   chicken breast minute steaks ((4 pieces x 100g/3oz each) (Note 1))
1/4 to 1/2 cup milk ((full fat or low fat))

recipeInstructions.text: Turn grill/broiler on high and place the shelf about 20cm/8" from the heat source.
recipeInstructions.name: Turn grill/broiler on high and place the shelf about 20cm/8" from the heat source.

recipeInstructions.text: Place potatoes in the microwave and cook on high for 3 minutes. Then turn the potatoes over and cook on high for a further 2 minutes (or until cooked). Squeeze the potatoes to check if they are cooked.
recipeInstructions.name: Place potatoes in the microwave and cook on high for 3 minutes. Then turn the potatoes over and cook on high for a further 2 minutes (or until cooked). Squeeze the potatoes to check if they are cooked.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix the mayonnaise and parmesan cheese in a small bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix the mayonnaise and parmesan cheese in a small bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: Place the chicken in a large oven proof fry pan (Note 5). Using the back of a spoon, spread the mayonnaise mixture over each chicken breast.
recipeInstructions.name: Place the chicken in a large oven proof fry pan (Note 5). Using the back of a spoon, spread the mayonnaise mixture over each chicken breast.

recipeInstructions.text: Sprinkle panko breadcrumbs over each piece of chicken. Use your fingers to pat the panko so it sticks to the chicken. (Note 6)
recipeInstructions.name: Sprinkle panko breadcrumbs over each piece of chicken. Use your fingers to pat the panko so it sticks to the chicken. (Note 6)

recipeInstructions.text: Place chicken under the grill/broiler for 8 minutes, or until just cooked through and the crumbs are golden. Check it once at around 6 minutes and rotate the fry pan if necessary so the crumb cooks evenly all over. When cooked, set aside to rest for a few minutes before serving.
recipeInstructions.name: Place chicken under the grill/broiler for 8 minutes, or until just cooked through and the crumbs are golden. Check it once at around 6 minutes and rotate the fry pan if necessary so the crumb cooks evenly all over. When cooked, set aside to rest for a few minutes before serving.

recipeInstructions.text: While the chicken is cooking, get the potatoes out of the microwave (use a dishcloth). Cut each potato in half, then use a dessert spoon to scoop the flesh out into a bowl. Add milk, butter, salt and pepper. Use a potato masher to mash. Add more milk to achieve the desired consistency.
recipeInstructions.name: While the chicken is cooking, get the potatoes out of the microwave (use a dishcloth). Cut each potato in half, then use a dessert spoon to scoop the flesh out into a bowl. Add milk, butter, salt and pepper. Use a potato masher to mash. Add more milk to achieve the desired consistency.

recipeInstructions.text: Salad: Use a potato peeler to make ribbons from the cucumber. Cut the cherry tomatoes in half. Pile the cucumber and cherry tomatoes onto a plate, then drizzle over lemon juice, olive oil and scatter with salt and pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: Salad: Use a potato peeler to make ribbons from the cucumber. Cut the cherry tomatoes in half. Pile the cucumber and cherry tomatoes onto a plate, then drizzle over lemon juice, olive oil and scatter with salt and pepper.

recipeInstructions.text: To Serve: Place mashed potato on each plate then top with the chicken. Drizzle with extra olive oil and garnish with finely chopped fresh parsley, if desired. Serve the Salad on the side.
recipeInstructions.name: To Serve: Place mashed potato on each plate then top with the chicken. Drizzle with extra olive oil and garnish with finely chopped fresh parsley, if desired. Serve the Salad on the side.

review.reviewBody: The mash potato and chicken is so good my family loved it!

Made this tonight. Was rather skeptical of the flavors but oh man, this was more than good! Absolutely delicious! I seasoned my chicken prior to putting the parm/Mayo mixture on top. Excellent recipe!
This was so beautiful. I used gluten free breadcrumbs, and I coated both sides. It was divine!

Made the chicken and salad exactly as written, only I made air fryer potato wedges instead of mashed potatoes because we'd had mashed potatoes already this week. Ate the chicken with sauces we already had on hand. Very good dinner. Will make again. The chicken especially got a lot of compliments for being so tender!

My family loves this chicken, and I'm "forced" to make it all the time. "Crunchy chicken - yay!" It's really easy and super tasty with a quick side salad. I've made the mash and cucumber salad too (equally delish and super easy). Here's my 2 cents - I cook the chicken in my cast iron pan on the lower rack in the oven on broil - sometimes it cooks a bit quickly so I'll start broiling until it begins to brown well, then cover it in foil to make sure the chicken cooks but doesn't burn, then remove the foil and then crisp it up at the end. Magic!
